definition: in those days/then/in those years/during that time
at or in the very same.../suitable/adequate/fitting/proper/to replace/to regard as/to think/to pawn/(coll.) to fail (a student)
to be/to act as/manage/withstand/when/during/ought/should/match equally/equal/same/obstruct/just at (a time or place)/on the spot/right/just at
to be in the prime of life
(of one's skills, appearance etc) not to have deteriorated a bit/to be as (good, vigorous etc) as ever
a real man doesn't boast about his past achievements (idiom)
pinyin: hao3 han4 bu4 ti2 dang1 nian2 yong3

sentences.english: In the intensive care unit, beam aunt continue to talk to her mother that year.
sentences.chinese: 重症病房里，梁大妈继续跟马母说着当年的事。

sentences.english: We were both on the tennis team.
sentences.chinese: 我们当年都是校网球队的。

sentences.english: The mistake is caused by the situation today, Sheng Maolin too late to regret.
sentences.chinese: 当年的误以为是造成了今天的局面，盛茂林追悔莫及。

sentences.english: The magpies nest year high, waterlogging rain.
sentences.chinese: 喜鹊搭窝高，当年雨水涝。

sentences.english: The Bells of Bow Church spoke truly when they chimed to young Dick.
sentences.chinese: 当年包教堂的钟声对年轻的迪克的确说了真话。

sentences.english: Those early years' folding Ru old grudge have already eliminated thin?
sentences.chinese: 难道当年的折辱仇恨已经消淡了？

sentences.english: In those years, workers lived right on those cliffs.
sentences.chinese: 当年修渠的勇士们就住在那些山崖上。

sentences.english: Liu Bei lost no time in telling his brothers the story of King Wen bent on visiting one of his subjects called Jiang Ziya.
sentences.chinese: 刘备忙讲了当年文王访姜子牙的故事。

sentences.english: The 54-year-old had promised during the campaign to serve out his term as mayor.
sentences.chinese: 当年54岁的朱立伦在竞选中承诺将服满市长任期。

sentences.english: Look, here are the tools they used then.
sentences.chinese: 你看，这些就是当年修渠的人们使用的工具。

sentences.english: The Weill family were very close-knit, as were many immigrant Jewish families of that era.
sentences.chinese: 一如当年许多犹太移民家族，魏尔家也是非常团结的。

sentences.english: It was no great distance, in those days, from the prison-door to the market-place.
sentences.chinese: 当年，从牢门到市场没有几步路。

sentences.english: The appropriate direction lost many elites in those early annuals, it was under the archaic divine tree to fair cage him.
sentences.chinese: 当年正道损失无数精英，才将他困在上古神木之下。

sentences.english: I was back on the physical irks , but now do not they became a physics teacher?
sentences.chinese: 我当年对物理很厌烦，可现在不也当了个物理老师吗？

sentences.english: His voice is no longer young children, more powerful.
sentences.chinese: 他的声音不再是当年稚嫩的童音，变得浑厚有力。

sentences.english: The 42-year-old one-time heart-throb cut a distinctly portly figure.
sentences.chinese: 当年的大众情人如今已经42岁，身体发福。

definition: once/already/former/previously/ever/(past tense marker used before verb or clause)
things change with the passage of time (idiom)
(idiom) up to the present/even now/now (in contrast with the past)/at this late hour

that one/that thing/that (as opposed to this)/(used before a verb or adjective for emphasis)/(used to humorously or indirectly refer to sth embarrassing, funny etc, or when one can't think of the right word)/(used in speech as a filler, similar to "umm", "you know" etc)/(euph.) menstruation/sex/also pr. [nei4 ge5]
of/~'s (possessive particle)/(used after an attribute)/(used to form a nominal expression)/(used at the end of a declarative sentence for emphasis)
